abstract.p: The TF IDF component helps compute the TF-IDF value of a word or phrase for a collection of files or for rows of column(s) of a tab-delimited file. TF-IDF stands for "Term Frequency - Inverse Document Frequency".

info.description: This component computes the TF-IDF value of a search word or phrase for a collection of files or for rows of column(s) of a tab-delimited file.

inputs.p: For Columns in a file: a tab-delimited file is required.
For Files: a zip file that contains PDF, Words and/or plain text files is required.

options.p:
For Columns in a file (tab-delimited file):
Text Column: select one or more columns to compute TF-IDF values on.
Term Type: select from Word or Phrase.
Exclude Stop Words: select yes to no for excluding stop words from the TF-IDF result.
Term: the search term for computing TF-IDF. Note: search term should be consistent with the Term Type and Exclude Stop Words options. For example, if you select Phrase and Yes to Exclude Stop Word, "the word" is not a good term.

For Files (zip file that contains PDF, Words and/or plain text files):
Term Type: select from Word or Phrase.
Exclude Stop Words: select yes to no for excluding stop words from the TF-IDF result.
Term: the search term for computing TF-IDF. Note: search term should be consistent with the Term Type and Exclude Stop Words options. For example, if you select Phrase and Yes to Exclude Stop Word, "the word" is not a good term.
